abstract: Google joins a telecom group to build a trans-Pacific undersea cable to reduce its high costs of sending search, video and applications traffic around the world.
snippet: Google joins a telecom group to build a trans-Pacific undersea cable to reduce its high costs of sending search, video and applications traffic around the world.
lead_paragraph: Google said Monday that it was part of a six-company consortium that would build a new $300 million high-capacity underwater fiber-optic cable linking the United States and Japan.

abstract: FriendFeed, the social, shared feed reader similar to Facebook’s news feed, has announced a $5 million round of funding from Benchmark Capital as well as FriendFeed’s co-founders and former employees of Google, Paul Buchheit and Sanjeev Singh.
lead_paragraph: FriendFeed, the social, shared feed reader similar to Facebook’s news feed, has announced a $5 million round of funding from Benchmark Capital as well as FriendFeed’s co-founders and former employees of Google, Paul Buchheit and Sanjeev Singh.

abstract: Yahoo is starting to reveal tidbits of its ambitious advertising system. It appears to be taking the merger of Google and DoubleClick head on in both technology and the use of data about users.
snippet: Yahoo is starting to reveal tidbits of its ambitious advertising system. It appears to be taking the merger of Google and DoubleClick head on in both technology and the use of data about users.
lead_paragraph: The meat of the presentation by Jerry Yang, chief executive, and Sue Decker, president, of Yahoo at the Interactive Advertising Bureau’s convention Monday was a new advertising system called Apex (for Advertiser Publisher Exchange).

headline.main: Yahoo Reveals (Some) Details About Its Ad Plans

abstract: Randy Falco, the chief executive of AOL, told a group of advertising executives that Microsoft is making a mistake in going after Yahoo. Unlike Google, which is trying to block the deal, he’s not going to get in the way.
snippet: Randy Falco, the chief executive of AOL, told a group of advertising executives that Microsoft is making a mistake in going after Yahoo. Unlike Google, which is trying to block the deal, he’s not going to get in the way.
lead_paragraph: Nobody could get off the stage at the Interactive Advertising Bureau convention here in Phoenix without being asked about the prospect of Microsoft’s acquisition of Yahoo.

headline.main: Randy Falco’s Napoleonic Strategy at AOL
